docs.title: services-test2
docs.text:
This repository is used to test services and configurations. Nothing to see here.

Documentation: https://afuetterer.github.io/services-test2

Source Code: https://github.com/afuetterer/services-test2

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
You can install services-test2 via pip from Test PyPI:

$ pip install -i https://test.pypi.org/simple/ --extra-index-url https://pypi.org/simple services-test

docs.title: License
docs.text: services-test2 is licensed under the terms of the MIT license.

docs.text:

docs.title: services-test2
docs.text:
services-test Command Line Interface.

Usage:

services-test2 [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options:

Name Type Description Default -V, --version boolean Show the version and exit. False --install-completion boolean Install completion for the current shell. None --show-completion boolean Show completion for the current shell, to copy it or customize the installation. None --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: hello
docs.text:
Hello world command.

Usage:

services-test2 hello [OPTIONS] MSG

Options:

Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: cli(version=typer.Option(False, '-V', '--version', callback=version_callback, is_eager=True, help='Show the version and exit.'))
docs.text:
services-test Command Line Interface.

Source code in services_test2/cli.py 
@app.callback(context_settings=CONTEXT_SETTINGS)
def cli(
    version: bool = typer.Option(  # noqa: B008
        False,
        "-V",
        "--version",
        callback=version_callback,
        is_eager=True,
        help="Show the version and exit.",
    ),
) -> None:
"""services-test Command Line Interface."""

docs.title: hello(msg=typer.Argument(Ellipsis, help='The message.'))
docs.text:
Hello world command.

Source code in services_test2/cli.py 
@app.command()
def hello(msg: str = typer.Argument(..., help="The message.")) -> None:  # noqa: B008
"""Hello world command."""
    typer.echo(hello_world(msg))

docs.title: World
docs.text:
Hello world.

Source code in services_test2/lib.py 
class World:
"""Hello world."""

    def send_message(self, msg: str) -> str:
"""Uppercases a message string.

        The given message string will be uppercased and then returned.

        Args:
            msg: A message.

        Returns:
            An uppercase version of the input message.

        """
        result = msg.upper()
        return result

docs.title: send_message(msg)
docs.text:
Uppercases a message string.

The given message string will be uppercased and then returned.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default msg str

A message.

required

Returns:

Type Description str

An uppercase version of the input message.

Source code in services_test2/lib.py 
def send_message(self, msg: str) -> str:
"""Uppercases a message string.

    The given message string will be uppercased and then returned.

    Args:
        msg: A message.

    Returns:
        An uppercase version of the input message.

    """
    result = msg.upper()
    return result

docs.title: hello_world(msg)
docs.text:
Uppercases a message string.

The given message string will be uppercased and then returned.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default msg str

A message.

required

Returns:

Type Description str

An uppercase version of the input message.

Source code in services_test2/lib.py 
def hello_world(msg: str) -> str:
"""Uppercases a message string.

    The given message string will be uppercased and then returned.

    Args:
        msg: A message.

    Returns:
        An uppercase version of the input message.

    """
    result = msg.upper()
    return result
